Cement production accounts for about 22% (1.5 Gt in 2005) of the industry sectorâ€™s total direct CO 2 emissions. Two thirds of this (0.94 Gt per year in 2005) is generated by the decomposition of limestone into cement clinker and CO 2. The remaining one third is from fuel combustion. The total CO 2 emissions during the cement making process are mainly due to:
raw material decomposition (59%),
fuel combustion (26%), and
electricity consumption (12%).
